title: 32 looming questions under center: What every NFL team still needs to answer about its QB situation
content: Will Philly's coordinator swap impact Jalen Hurts? Are Patrick Mahomes and Jayden Daniels headed for big years? Could Lamar Jackson get another big payday?

title: Sources: Mavs join in denying Knicks' requests
content: The Knicks have now been denied permission to speak with Dallas Mavericks coach Jason Kidd, Timberwolves coach Chris Finch and Rockets coach Ime Udoka, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Deion eager to rejoin Buffs after missed camps
content: Deion Sanders posted on social media Wednesday that "everything is OKAY" after the Buffaloes coach has not attended football camps in Boulder, Colorado.

title: WTA to protect rankings after fertility procedures
content: Women's tennis players who choose to undergo a fertility protection procedure will be allowed to take time away from the sport and return to competitive action with a protected ranking, the WTA announced Wednesday.

title: Switzerland routs U.S. in Gold Cup sendoff loss
content: The United States gave up four goals in the first half and looked unprepared for next year's World Cup, getting routed by Switzerland 4-0 in a friendly on Tuesday in Nashville, losing its fourth straight game for the first time since 2007.

title: Hard tag reignites Chisholm's feud with Garcia
content: The bad blood between the Yankees' Jazz Chisholm and the Royals' Maikel Garcia resurfaced Tuesday night when Chisholm left with a sore neck after an attempted tag from Garcia.

title: Bolts' Harbaugh had cardiac ablation, hip surgery
content: Chargers coach Jim Harbaugh said Tuesday that he had a successful cardiac ablation and offseason hip replacement surgery.

title: WR Adams: Joining Rams 'exactly what I needed'
content: Davante Adams has only been in Los Angeles for one offseason, but the new Rams wide receiver said he feels "rejuvenated" compared to his last few NFL seasons.

title: WADA urges U.S. to shut down Enhanced Games
content: The global watchdog of doping in sports said Wednesday it will urge public authorities to shut down the drug-fueled Enhanced Games planned in Las Vegas next year.

title: From Pacers turnovers to Thunder free throws, here's how the opening games produced statistical outliers
content: Among steals, scoring and other stats, which ones stand out and which might swing the rest of the Finals?

title: Storylines: Scheffler's dominance, DeChambeau's chances and how hard Oakmont will play
content: Is it Scottie Scheffler vs. the field this week? Could Oakmont produce an over-par winner? We look at five storylines to watch this week at the U.S. Open.

title: NFL minicamp 2025 live updates: Saquon Barkley refreshed, ready to run it back
content: The majority of NFL mandatory minicamps are in action this week. Our reporters have the latest from around the league.

title: Wetzel: It's new rules, same old game in NCAA athlete pay
content: College athletics is back in the rules business now that schools can directly pay players, Dan Wetzel writes.

title: The return of Javy Baez: How Detroit's $140 million man went from nearly off the roster to thriving
content: Months after hitting rock bottom, the Tigers' highest-paid player has rediscovered himself -- in a new role.

title: What all 30 MLB teams must do before the trade deadline
content: Is your team going to make a midsummer splash? Here's how the next few weeks could decide the season.

title: Forget the World Cup, USMNT doesn't look ready for the Gold Cup
content: Tuesday's capitulation will no doubt leave Mauricio Pochettino wondering what he has gotten himself into.

title: Our latest NBA mock draft: Back-and-forth on team need vs. best value
content: Best player available? Fill a need? We played out both strategies for 30 first-round slots in the draft.

title: 'Built for this time of year': How Sam Bennett transformed into a playoff MVP candidate
content: One shift in Game 3 encapsulated everything that the veteran center can do on the ice. Here's how he got here.

title: All you need to know one year out from the 2026 World Cup
content: It's Messi and Ronaldo's last dance, and new stars will be born. Just how far can the U.S. go? The big talking points 12 months out from the World Cup.

title: Alexis asks for forgiveness as Chile miss '26 WC
content: Chile will miss their third straight World Cup after losing 2-0 at Bolívia on Tuesday to remain last in South America's 10-team round-robin competition.

title: Van de Ven: 'Strange' choice to sack Postecoglou
content: Tottenham Hotspur defender Micky van de Ven has described the decision to sack manager Ange Postecoglou as "strange."

title: Tuchel: England 'frozen' in historic loss to Senegal
content: Thomas Tuchel admitted England were "frozen" in their 3-1 friendly defeat to Senegal but insisted there was no cause for panic ahead of next year's World Cup.

title: Man City bolster midfield with Reijnders signing
content: Manchester City have bolstered Pep Guardiola's midfield options with the signing of Tijjani Reijnders from AC Milan.

title: Hayes giving overworked U.S. stars summer break
content: United States coach Emma Hayes told ESPN she will call up a roster composed almost exclusively of domestic players for the team's training camp later this month to allow European-based players to rest after a long club season.

title: Sources: Wave's Sánchez in talks for Tigres return
content: San Diego Wave winger and Mexico international Maria Sanchez is currently in "very advanced" negotiations with Liga MX Femenil's Tigres, sources have told ESPN.

title: Mexico changes LA hotels over safety concerns
content: Mexico will change hotels in Los Angeles ahead of their Gold Cup match because of safety concerns amid the protests against immigration raids, a source told ESPN.

title: From U.S. to Suriname, one thing to know about every team
content: With the Gold Cup set to kick off on June 14, we provide the narratives, star names and trivia you need to know for every team in the 2025 tournament.

title: Whose NHL draft stock rose, declined at the scouting combine?
content: The annual event took place this past week in Buffalo -- with major repercussions for the draft on June 27-28.

title: Biggest surprise, head-scratcher and more from the transfer cycle
content: Which teams improved -- or hurt -- their outlook? We award winners and losers of this offseason's cycle.

title: Parenting and game plans: Inside Jenny Boucek's extraordinary basketball journey to the Pacers
content: For decades, Boucek had professional dreams and personal ones -- and believed they were mutually exclusive. Now, as a mom and the first front-of-the-bench female assistant in the NBA, she's finally living both.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Storm bounce back while Sky fall in Week 4 edition
content: Seattle returns to the top three while Chicago tumbles as the middle of the league finds its footing.

title: After 1946, World Saw Highest Number Of Armed Conflicts Last Year: Study
content: The world saw the highest number of armed conflicts in almost 80 years in 2024, dethroning 2023 as a record year, a Norwegian study published Wednesday showed, highlighting the risks linked to a US disengagement.

title: Trump Says "Deal With China Done" On Rare Earths And Student Visas
content: In a Truth Social post, Trump announced that Beijing will supply United States with"full magnets and all necessary rare earth materials." In exchange for this, United States will let Chinese students study at American colleges and universities.

title: 'Raat Gayi, Baat Gayi': Sachin Pilot On Feud With Ashok Gehlot
content: In one of the biggest political rapprochements in recent memory, senior Congress leaders Sachin Pilot and Ashok Gehlot were seen together at an event to commemorate the 25th death anniversary of the former's father and ex-Union Minister Rajesh Pilot.

title: Explained: What Is Behind ChatGPT's Frequent Outages
content: ChatGPT, OpenAI's widely used AI chatbot, is currently facing a major global outage, the fifth such disruption reported this year.

title: All Seats Booked For Next 10 Days On Kashmir Train Days After Inauguration
content: It's a booking frenzy for trains to Kashmir valley. The Katra-Srinagar Vande Bharat train service is seeing an unprecedented rush.

title: 107 Hospitalised After Eating Food Served During Tamil Nadu Temple Festival
content: At least 107 people were hospitalised in Madurai after reportedly consuming food served during a temple festival at Kalvimadai village in Tamil Nadu's Virudhunagar district on Sunday, officials said.

title: Trump Said He 'Could' Forgive Musk In An Interview, Before X Boss Apologised
content: After Musk lambasted his flagship bill, Trump said in the podcast that he was not happy. "It's the best thing we've ever signed in this country. When he did that, I was not a happy camper."

title: Man, 35, Stabbed To Death Over Fight Between Children In Delhi: Police
content: A 35-year-old man was stabbed to death allegedly by neighbours following a scuffle between children in outer Delhi's Sultanpuri area, an official said on Wednesday.

title: Supreme Court Refuses To Quash FIR Against Ex Judge Accused Of Raping Minor Daughter
content: Calling it "shocking", the Supreme Court on Wednesday refused to quash the criminal proceedings against a former judicial officer accused of sexually abusing his minor daughter.

title: We Have Boycotted Her, Cut All Ties: Sonam's Brother On Meghalaya Murder
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, who has reportedly confessed to killing her husband Raja Raghuvanshi in Meghalaya, has now been "boycotted" by her family. Her brother, Govind, met Raja's family and said her family wants her to be hanged if she is guilty.

title: Karnataka High Court Reserves Order On RCB's Petition After State Concludes Arguments
content: The Karnataka High Court on Wednesday reserved its order in the petitions filed by Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) and its marketing head Nikhil Sosale.

title: Woman Adds Sleeping Pills In Food To Kill Family, Hide Affair In Karnataka
content: A 33-year-old woman who tried to kill her family and in-laws by poisoning their food has been arrested in Karnataka's Hassan district.

title: Quantum Computing At Inflection Point, Can Outdo Advanced AI Systems: Nvidia CEO
content: Quantum computing technology is at an inflection point, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang reiterated on Wednesday at the VivaTech conference in Paris.

title: Russia Says Ready To Help Remove Excess Nuclear Material From Iran
content: The Kremlin confirmed on Wednesday that Russia was ready to help remove excess nuclear material from Iran if the United States and Tehran deemed such assistance useful.

title: Man Sentenced To Death For Rape And Murder Of Minor Girl In Bengal
content: A special POCSO court here awarded death sentence to a man for the rape and murder of a minor girl in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri district.

title: 1 Month After Wedding To Raja Raghuvanshi, Sonam's Murder Confession
content: Exactly one month after her marriage to 29-year-old Raja Raghuvanshi, Sonam Raghuvanshi, 24, has confessed to her role in his murder during their honeymoon in Meghalaya, sources have told NDTV.

title: Watch: On 78th Birthday, Lalu Yadav Cuts 78 kg Laddoo With Sword
content: Former Bihar chief minister Lalu Prasad Yadav celebrated his 78th birthday at his Patna residence on Wednesday. The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) supremo cut a 78-kg cake made entirely of laddooswith a sword.

title: Tight Security Arrangements Made For Amarnath Yatra: J&K Lt Governor
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Wednesday said foolproof security arrangements have been made for the forthcoming annual Amarnath Yatra and urged pilgrims to visit the cave shrine in large numbers.

title: Delhi Under Red Alert As Temperature Soars Beyond 45 Degrees Celsius
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Delhi as the city grapples with an intense heatwave, with maximum temperatures soaring to 45.5 degrees Celsius in several areas.

title: Indian Man Who Was Pinned Down At US Airport Had Entered Country Illegally
content: A man filmed being pinned to the floor and handcuffed by law enforcement officials in the United States has been identified as an Indian national who had illegally entered the country.

title: Drop move to conduct caste census, NSS writes to Centre
content: In a letter to the President, Vice-President and the Prime Minister, NSS general secretary G. Sukumaran Nair states that caste-based census contradicts the principles of the Constitution and risks dividing people on the basis of castes and religion. He draws parallels to the British colonial era, recalling the 1931 communal Census, which aimed to separate electorates by segregating the constituencies on the basis of religion

title: Launch of ‘Thalliki Vandanam’ scheme in Andhra Pradesh on June 12
content: Every school-going child will receive an amount of ₹15,000 annually under the ‘Super Six’ scheme, and the amount is credited directly to bank accounts of mothers; the government will disburse ₹8,745 crore under the scheme, benefiting 67 lakh mothers

title: Apollo Cancer Centres launches robotic pancreatic surgery programme
content: The programme aims to provide less invasive treatment options, especially for those previously been considered ineligible for surgery

title: Ashada Fridays: New measures to ease darshan at temple atop Chamundi hills
content: ₹2,000 fast-track darshan ticket to be introduced this year for devotees wishing for faster temple visits; private vehicles banned on Fridays and weekends during the season, free transport for devotees in buses to the hills

title: Centre upholds Wildlife (Protection) Act; turns down Kerala’s request for relaxation
content: Kerala had requested to relax the provisions of the Act for dealing with problematic wild animals and declare wild boars as vermin

title: ₹2,014-crore worth of development works sanctioned within a year in Kurnool: Nimmala Ramanaidu
content: Government committed to early completion of ₹80,000-crore Polavaram-Banakacherla project, while 563 hectares of drip irrigation projects already completed in the district, says Minister for Water Resources

title: Indian Army contingent arrives in Mongolia for Exercise Khaan Quest
content: Multinational peacekeeping drill from June 14 to 28 to focus on interoperability and readiness under U.N. mandate

title: Baghel alleges raids in Chhattisgarh followed after his call for accountability over Pahalgam terror strike
content: Former Chief Minister links central agency action to his criticism over Pahalgam attack; no official response yet

title: Congress MLA Vinay Kulkarni to surrender before court on Friday
content: The former Minister, who is accused of being involved in murder, will go to Bengaluru now in the wake of the Supreme Court cancelling his bail

title: Vedan’s song included in Calicut University syllabus
content: Rap song Bhoomi Njan Vaazhunna idam to be part of fourth-semester undergraduate Malayalam Language and Literature course

title: Power generation at full capacity in Kerala hydel power plants to avoid sudden opening of dam shutters
content: Moolamattom  power plant produced 16.942 million units on June 10,  Tuesday which is an increase from the average production of 4 to 5 million units in the last week of May

title: Addicts approaching Alcoholics Anonymous soar despite worsening drug menace
content: The Ernakulam Intergroup of AA, formed in 1990, roughly, has around 50,000 persons currently associated with it or benefited from that association

title: Governor Arlekar convenes V-Cs’ meet on June 17; key higher education issues to be discussed
content: While the primary agenda includes an evaluation of anti-drug campaigns carried out on campuses, the discussions are likely to delve into various issues faced by the higher education sector

title: UDF alleges corruption behind hiring lorries for removing silt to Brahmapuram
content: The tender invited for the transportation by the engineering wing based on the Mayor’s prior approval is riddled with problems, alleges UDF councillors

title: CBI files chargesheet against eight accused in French visa fraud case
content: The accused targeted applicants from Punjab seeking Schengen visas, through a network of visa agents, and ‘received money ranging from ₹13 lakh to ₹45 lakh from each visa applicant’, the agency said

title: Cyient Foundation and AICTE sign MoU to build innovation cluster in Visakhapatnam
content: Under the MoU, the pilot programme will focus on transforming higher education institutions in and around Visakhapatnam into vibrant hubs of innovation by fostering collaboration between academia, industry, startups, and investors

title: Siddaramaiah writes to Maharashtra Chief Minister defending decision to increase Almatti dam height
content: ‘By this letter, Karnataka has clarified its stand not only on submergence issue but also on its right to raise Almatti dam height’

title: Two TDP activists and a constable injured as violence erupts during Jagan’s visit to Podili
content: Trouble breaks out as YSRCP cadre and leaders pelt stones and slippers on women staging a protest seeking an apology from the YSRCP chief for the alleged derogatory remarks on Amaravati women during a debate on the TV channel his family owns

title: What to know ahead of the Canadian Grand Prix
content: What to know as Formula 1 heads to Circuit Gilles-Villeneuve in Montreal for round 10 of the 2025 season.

title: Daniel Suárez sees global potential as he leads NASCAR into Mexico
content: Suárez returns to race in Mexico for the first time in a decade, and he thinks this is just the beginning of NASCAR's world tour.

title: Pound for pound: Dvalishvili leapfrogs MMA GOAT
content: UFC men's bantamweight champion Merab Dvalishvili's submission win over Sean O'Malley was enough to pass the best fighter in MMA history, but was it enough to claim the top spot?

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: Bennett overtakes McDavid as Conn Smythe fave
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United's Garnacho a target for Aston Villa
content: Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho is attracting interest from Aston Villa. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Leopard kills calf near Punganur
content: Forest officials appeal to the locals to not shelter their livestock at night on fields that abut the forests

title: Alappuzha farmers incur crop loss of ₹33.68 lakh in two months
content: Crops on 162.27 ha destroyed between April 1 and June 9, affecting 2,270 farmers. Supplyco procures 1.07 lakh tonnes of paddy as puncha season concludes

title: Kerala University’s archaeological excavation unearths 5,300-year-old Early Harappan settlement in Gujarat
content: The site was first identified in 2022 by a team led by Abhayan G.S. and Rajesh S.V. from the Department of Archaeology, Kerala University

title: Uncertainty lingers over land rights on forest fringe settlements despite interventions
content: Proposal for formulating guidelines and action plan to redraw the boundaries of Periyar Tiger Reserve and the Thattekkadu Bird Sanctuary triggers apprehensions in the families living here

title: Adani Krishnapatnam Port handles 5.74 million tonnes of dry cargo in May
content: It is the highest-ever monthly dry cargo volume handled by any port in India, according to the company

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation retakes possession of unoccupied and rented out welfare scheme flats
content: 15 flats have been taken over and reallocated to families identified as landless and homeless under the State government’s project to uplift extremely poor families.

title: Jagan warns of agitation if NDA government in Andhra Pradesh fails to support tobacco farmers
content: The YSRCP president has demanded that the State government rope in Markfed to ensure a price of at least ₹280 per kg to the distressed farmers

title: Karnataka’s Shakti scheme completes two years, over 474 crore free rides for women recorded
content: According to data shared by the transport department, between June 11, 2023, and June 10, 2025, the four corporations together recorded a total of 801.54 crore passenger journeys

title: Draft Waqf Rules propose steep cut in annual contributions to State Waqf Boards
content: The draft rules, which are being circulated among the State governments and the State boards, have proposed to fix the maximum amount annually payable by the individual Waqfs to the board at ₹5,000.

title: Interpol crackdown: 20,000 malicious IPs and domains taken down globally, 32 suspects arrested
content: Law enforcement agencies from 26 countries, including India, worked to locate the servers, map physical networks, and execute targeted takedowns

title: Delhi under 'red alert' as mercury soars beyond 45 degrees C; severe heatwave conditions to persist
content: Humidity levels in the capital remained moderate at 39% during the early hours, but the combination of heat and dry south-westerly winds has worsened the discomfort

title: Electoral rolls prep in India one of world's most rigorous, transparent exercises: CEC
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar highlights the rigorous and transparent preparation of electoral rolls in India amid allegations of fudging

title: TVK chief Vijay appoints office-bearers for social media, legal wings
content: According to a press release from the party, 10 office-bearers were appointed for each wing at the State level

title: Indian Railways begin trial to confirm tickets for waiting passengers 24 hours before departure
content: Railway Ministry officials assured that the pilot project would become part of the policy only after receiving a positive response from the passengers

content: The increased line capacity will significantly enhance mobility, resulting in improved operational efficiency and service reliability for Indian Railways, said a government press note

title: 11 years of Modi government shining example of 'failures', 'anti-people policies': Congress
content: Bhupesh Baghel alleged that the BJP leaders enjoy insulting and harassing people, yet no action is taken against anyone under this government

title: Constitution doesn’t pretend all are equal in land scarred by deep inequality: CJI Gavai in Oxford
content: ‘For India’s most vulnerable citizens, the Constitution is not merely a legal charter or a political framework. It is a feeling, a lifeline, a quiet revolution etched in ink,’ the second Dalit Chief Justice of India said in his Oxford Union address

title: Will not allow KCR’s family into Congress; all facts about Kaleshwaram to be presented in two days: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy
content: The Chief Minister also confirmed that the new ministers inducted into the cabinet would be allotted portfolios as soon as he returns to Hyderabad from New Delhi

title: Kerala govt increases school hours for Classes VIII to X by half an hour to meet RTE Act requirements
content: Revised timings to come into effect immediately; applicable to government, aided, and recognised unaided schools following State syllabus. Fridays exempted

title: Centre attempts to ‘suppress’ glory of ancient Tamil civilisation unearthed at Keeladi: Vaiko
content: Mr. Vaiko’s remarks came against the backdrop of Union Culture Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat’s recent observation that the reports submitted to the ASI by archaeologist Amarnath Ramakrishna are not technically well-supported

content: The veteran Congress leader also criticises the PM for ignoring past governments’ contributions to expansion of the rail network in Kashmir Valley

content: The statement did not elaborate on what “anti-party activities” it had acted against MLA Laxman Singh for

title: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge justifies fresh caste census in Karnataka
content: Says much has changed since the last caste census in 2015, with several communities being reclassified

title: Jaishankar welcomes European Parliament members’ backing for stronger India-EU ties
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar meets European Parliament leaders to strengthen India-European Union relations and combat terrorism

title: MSC Elsa 3 shipwreck: Kerala Police register case
content: Case against owner of Liberia-flagged vessel, ship master, crew, and others. FIR says ship carrying dangerous goods, including explosives, was handled by crew recklessly

title: Re-enumeration of castes: BJP calls it ‘diversionary tactic’, demands CM’s resignation for endorsing ‘flawed’ data
content: BJP termed re-survey an effort to divert attention from the stampede during the RCB’s victory celebrations in Bengaluru that claimed 11 lives

title: Two workers killed in explosion at fireworks unit near Kariyapatti in T.N.
content: Over 130 persons were working at the unit when a chemical reaction in one of the working sheds — where chemicals were being filled to manufacture ‘bijili’ crackers — led to an explosion around 9 a.m.

title: India raises with U.S. incident of 'ill-treatment' of Indian man at Newark airport
content: The Indian Consulate in New York has ascertained that the man hailing from Haryana had entered the U.S. illegally without a valid visa and was being deported back to India as per a court order, th

title: Govt working on draft framework to standardise default temperatures of air conditioners: Union Power Minister Manohar Lal
content: BEE is engaged in preparing a draft framework to standardise AC temperatures in the range of 20-28 degrees, says an official

title: Meghalaya honeymoon horror: Meghalaya court sends Sonam, aides to 8-day police custody
content: The special investigation team sought police custody of the accused to reconstruct the crime scene in Sohra

title: Kerala CM’s daughter T. Veena denies allegations in CMRL case, terms PIL a bid to ‘vilify’ her
content: In affidavit before Kerala High Court, T. Veena refutes charges that Exalogic Solutions Private Limited is a benami firm and says it is operated independently of her father

title: Modi govt using laws like UAPA to stifle dissent: Congress
content: The Opposition party hit out at the government and cited several cases, including those of Anand Teltumbde, Nodeep Kaur, Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, Prabir Purkayastha and Amit Chakravarty

title: Lakhs congregate in Lord Jagannath temple in Puri to witness Deva Snana Purnima
content: The festival, known as Deva Snana Purnima, takes place on the full moon day in the month of Jyestha, and this is the first occasion in a year when the wooden idols are brought out of the sanctum sanctorum in a procession and placed on the 'Snana Mandap' for the bathing rituals.

title: Challenging times for global trade; India will certainly cross $825 billion exports this fiscal: Piyush Goyal
content: Apex exporters' body FIEO has projected that the country's overall goods and services exports are expected to grow by over 21% year-on-year to $1 trillion during 2025-26

title: Supreme Court trashes appeals of two convicts in rape case of minor school girl
content: The top court upholds life imprisonment for convicts in 2019 kidnapping and rape case of 13-year-old girl

title: Will PM agree to have full debate in Parliament on country’s post-Pahalgam security, asks Congress
content: Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh questions PM Modi’s response to security challenges, foreign policy, and terrorism post-Pahalgam attack

title: Kerala Economics and Statistics dept report pegs average monthly income of agricultural households at ₹28,984
content: Of this, crop production by itself accounts for a mere 22.97% (₹6,658), with the rest being contributed by wages (60.71%), animal farming (6.25%), non-farm business (9.93% and income from leasing out land (0.13%)

title: In search of Chilika’s Irrawaddy dolphins
content: We set out at dawn on a boat from Rambha in Odisha’s Chilika lake, hoping to catch a glimpse of the elusive Irrawaddy dolphin. Do we get lucky?

title: Farmers seek early implementation of Kalasa Banduri Nala project in Karnataka
content: They allege that some vested interests are trying to stop the project, which is meant for providing drinking water to people

title: C. V. Raman hospital ties up with NGO to provide geriatric and palliative care closer to home in Bengaluru
content: As part of the collaboration, a 12-bed ward including six-beds for female patients has been set aside in the hospital

title: Rahul writes to PM, flags ‘unhygienic’ living conditions in hostels, delay in scholarships for students from marginalised communities
content: The Opposition leader called for an audit of every hostel for students from Dalit, ST, EBC, OBC and minority communities to ensure good infrastructure, sanitation, and food and academic facilities

title: Eight IPS officers in Chhattisgarh get new postings for anti-Maoist operations
content: Chhattisgarh Government deploys eight IPS officers for anti-Maoist operations following ASP Girepunje ’s death in IED blast

title: 'Deal is done': Trump says China will supply rare earths, magnets; US to allow Chinese students
content: Donald Trump announced a US-China trade deal, pending his and Xi Jinping's approval. The US will impose 55% tariffs, while China will apply 10%. China will supply magnets and rare earth minerals, and Chinese students can continue studying in America.

title: Raja was dead, but his post went up at 2.15am — Inside police's ‘Operation Honeymoon’
content: Meghalaya Police cracked the murder case of Indore transporter Raja Raghuvanshi, codenamed 'Operation Honeymoon,' after noticing the couple's lack of social media posts and analyzing surveillance footage. The investigation revealed Sonam Raghuvanshi's involvement, including her meeting with contract killers and providing a raincoat to one of the assailants.

title: UPSC prelims result announced for Civil Services and IFS exams: Check direct links here
content: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has declared the results of the Civil Services (Preliminary) Examination, 2025, held on May 25, 2025. Candidates have been shortlisted for both the Civil Services and Indian Forest Service (Main) Examinations. A submission window from June 16 to June 25 has been announced for uploading required details. Results for four candidates have been withheld. The full list and further instructions are available on the official UPSC website.

title: ITR filing: Several changes in Form 16! Top things salaried taxpayers shouldn’t miss
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: For fiscal year 2024-25,  Form 16 will reflect changes like increased standard deduction under the new tax regime. It will also show tax deductions from other income sources. It's important to take note of the changes.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There’s a new programming language. It is called…
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Siddaramaiah says he got invite hours before event
content: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah clarified that the RCB felicitation event, following which a stampede occurred, was organized by the KSCA and RCB, not the state government.

title: Exclusive: Bangladeshi player deported from India; 80-yo legend Rani Hamid 'disturbed' by events
content: Bangladeshi chess player Rani Hamid, 80, arrived in Delhi for a tournament, but her companion Ashiya Sultana was denied entry and deported due to a previous visa violation. This incident has deeply upset Hamid, impacting her performance in the competition. Despite the emotional distress, she appreciates the support from the Delhi Chess Association.

title: S&P warning on phone prices in US: Even if it leads to some demand destruction...
content: S&P Global Ratings anticipates that US tariffs will lead to increased smartphone and PC prices as manufacturers pass on higher costs to consumers. Companies like Apple, heavily reliant on China's production infrastructure, are particularly vulnerable. While some companies are shifting production to countries like India and Vietnam, potential tariff increases still pose a threat to the US market.

title: Patch-up soon? Trump says 'don't blame' Musk for anything
content: Donald Trump has signaled a potential reconciliation with Elon Musk, stating he holds no ill will towards the billionaire despite past disagreements. Trump expressed surprise at Musk's criticism of his spending bill but acknowledged Musk's subsequent regret over his remarks. This apparent thaw follows a public dispute ignited by Musk's disapproval of Trump's proposed legislation.

title: Chips and cola in hands, man holds 4 sons on tracks till train crushes them
content: While leaving home near Subhash Colony around 12.15pm, Manoj — originally from Bihar — told his wife Priya that he was taking the kids to a nearby park to play. Instead, he took them to the tracks and sat under Elson Chowk flyover for about an hour, waiting for the train to arrive. He bought chips and soft drinks for the kids.

title: Buying an iPhone in Dubai vs India: Majorprosandcons; cost savings yes, but ...
content: For Indian Apple enthusiasts, purchasing the iPhone 16 in Dubai presents a mixed bag. While Pro models offer potential cost savings, non-Pro versions might be pricier. Buying in Dubai means missing out on Indian bank offers and exchange discounts. FaceTime restrictions and potential import duties also need consideration, impacting the overall value proposition.

title: 'My sister is guilty, will make sure she is punished': Brother disowns Sonam
content: In a surprising turn, Govind Raghuwanshi, brother of the prime suspect Sonam, visited the victim's family to offer a sincere apology and express his support for their pursuit of justice. He asserted Sonam's guilt and pledged to ensure she faces punishment for her actions. Govind distanced himself from the other accused, emphasising his commitment to justice for Raja Raghuwanshi.

title: Axiom-4 setback: Why Shubhanshu Shukla's spaceflight keeps getting delayed
content: The Axiom-4 mission, featuring Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, faces further delays due to a liquid oxygen leak detected in SpaceX's Falcon-9 rocket. This issue, stemming from a previous Starlink mission, coupled with unfavorable weather, has postponed the launch.

title: Khaby Lame deported: What TikTok star's treatment tells us about Trump's America
content: Khaby didn’t need punchlines. His comedic empire was built on the ability to mock overly complicated solutions to simple problems — slicing through the internet’s life-hack clutter with a single shrug. But no number of well-timed glances could rescue him from the labyrinth of U.S. visa law.

title: 'Phenomenal partner in counter-terrorism': Top US general lauds Pakistan
content: A top US general has lauded Pakistan as a crucial counter-terrorism ally, highlighting their role in combating ISIS-K. General Kurilla cited Pakistan's efforts in capturing high-value ISIS-K individuals and extraditing a key suspect in the Kabul airport bombing.

title: 'I regret some of my posts': Musk blinks in fight with Trump - will US President respond?
content: Elon Musk expressed regret over some posts against Donald Trump. He said he went too far. Musk had accused Trump of being in the Epstein files. He deleted some posts, including one supporting Trump's impeachment. Trump expressed disappointment at Musk's criticism of his bill. The President said he had a great relationship with Musk.

title: 'No remorse whatsoever': Gangster Goldy Brar's cold confession on Moosewala murder
content: Goldy Brar, a Canada-based gangster, justified the killing of Sidhu Moosewala, stating the singer faced consequences for his actions. Brar revealed a long-standing feud stemming from a Kabaddi match and Moosewala's alleged support for rivals.

title: Quasi moon: China's Tianwen takes first image of celestial object; asteroid originated from Moon
content: China has released the first image from its Tianwen 2 spacecraft. The spacecraft is on a mission to collect samples from a quasi-moon. The mission launched on May 29. The spacecraft is already millions of kilometers from Earth. Tianwen 2 will approach Kamo'oalewa in July 2026. Kamo'oalewa is a small asteroid. Scientists believe it may have originated from the Moon.

title: 'Will come to haunt you': Jaishankar's terrorism warning to West
content: In Brussels, S. Jaishankar addressed the international media's narrative on Operation Sindoor, questioning Osama bin Laden's presence in Pakistan. He emphasized that terrorism, not just India-Pakistan relations, is the core issue. Jaishankar also defended India's neutral stance on the Russia-Ukraine war, advocating for peaceful resolution.

title: Vanessa Bryant breaks silence on wild pregnancy rumors with a Rihanna meme
content: Vanessa Bryant addressed pregnancy rumors with a playful Instagram Story featuring Rihanna, shutting down speculation with humor and a clear message about protecting her peace. She emphasized the importance of inner character over material possessions, sharing motivational quotes and highlighting her focus on family and philanthropy. Bryant's response underscored her right to privacy amidst public scrutiny.

title: SBI Clerk Mains Result: Scorecards out at sbi.co.in; check your marks
content: The State Bank of India (SBI) has declared the clerk mains result 2025 for 13,735 Junior Associate vacancies. The exam, held in April, tested candidates on General Awareness, English, Quantitative Aptitude, and Reasoning. Results are available in PDF format on sbi.co.in. Candidates can check their roll numbers to confirm qualification. SBI had earlier released Ladakh results. Qualified candidates should watch for further recruitment updates and joining instructions.

title: Man strangles wife after row over phone chats with another woman; arrested
content: In Hyderabad's Saroornagar, Maria Das allegedly murdered his wife, Chinnamma, following arguments over his phone conversations with another woman. Das, a car driver, is now in police custody. The couple, originally from East Godavari, had been married for 12 years and have a son. Chinnamma had confronted Das about the other woman, leading to frequent disputes.

title: 'Why do I need RCB? I don't even drink Royal Challenge': Karnataka Deputy CM on buying IPL franchise - WATCH
content: Speculation arose about the sale of Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Diageo India denied these reports to the Bombay Stock Exchange. Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar refuted claims of his involvement in purchasing the team. He clarified his association with the Karnataka Cricket Association. Lalit Modi suggested a high valuation for RCB.

title: From India to Lord's! India bowling legend plays a role in WTC Final
content: Temba Bavuma won the toss, electing to bowl first against Australia in the World Test Championship final at Lord's, citing favorable overhead conditions. Marnus Labuschagne opened for Australia, while South Africa included Wiaan Mulder and Lungi Ngidi in their lineup.

title: Cabinet approves 2 big Indian Railways projects - Check details
content: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved two railway projects totaling Rs. 6,405 crore. These projects include doubling the Koderma-Barkakana track in Jharkhand and the Ballari-Chikjajur line across Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh.

title: 'Housefull 5': Movie opens on decent note on day 6; crosses ₹110 crore milestone
content: Housefull 5, after a strong opening weekend, is holding decently well during the weekdays. The multistarrer, mounted on a huge budget, earned ₹24 crore on its opening day and has collected ₹114.1 crore in India so far. While Monday saw a dip, the film is expected to maintain double-digit numbers throughout the week.

title: ‘Deplorable hostels, delayed scholarships’: Rahul Gandhi writes letter to PM Modi
content: Rahul Gandhi has addressed Prime Minister Modi, highlighting the dire conditions in residential hostels for marginalized students, including overcrowding, unhygienic conditions, and lack of resources. He also pointed out significant delays and reduced amounts in post-matric scholarships, using Bihar as an example of a nationwide problem, urging immediate audits and increased funding.

title: New tatkal ticket rules: Railways announce compulsory Aadhaar authentication
content: Indian Railways is set to implement new Tatkal ticket booking rules starting July 1, 2025, requiring Aadhaar authentication for users booking through IRCTC. From July 15, an additional Aadhaar-based OTP verification will be mandatory.

title: 'Muslim countries have 644 times amount of land controlled by Israel': Huckabee
content: US ambassador Mike Huckabee suggested Muslim countries should cede land for a Palestinian state, noting their vast land advantage over Israel. He views the two-state solution as merely aspirational, a stance differing from international consensus.

title: “Seeking attention”: Aaron Rodgers slammed over wedding reveal; called hypocrite on privacy
content: Aaron Rodgers' recent move to the Pittsburgh Steelers has been overshadowed by the revelation of his marriage to Brittani. While Rodgers confirmed the news, his public discussion of his personal life has sparked criticism from fans online. Many fans feel Rodgers is seeking attention despite his past complaints about media intrusion into his relationships, particularly his dating life.

title: Magic Johnson slams major Indiana Pacers: “They can’t beat Oklahoma City playing like that”
content: Following the Indiana Pacers' Game 2 loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder, Lakers legend Magic Johnson criticized their half-court-focused offense. Johnson urged Tyrese Haliburton to prioritize scoring early and ignite Indiana's transition game. Haliburton acknowledged the Thunder's defensive pressure and vowed to improve. With the series tied, the Pacers return home needing to adjust their strategy to avoid falling behind.

title: Musk loses 25% of his wealth to DOGE; calls it 'worth it'
content: Elon Musk's association with Donald Trump's administration seemingly impacted his wealth, with Tesla's stock plummeting 33% since Trump's inauguration. Despite losses, Musk remains among the wealthiest, though his political stances are under scrutiny. Recent tensions, including Musk's call for Trump's impeachment, have seemingly cooled, with both figures softening their rhetoric.

title: People pray to tree in ‘miracle’ frenzy, engineers discover pipe leak below
content: A crowd in Pimpri's Premlok Park worshipped a gulmohar tree, mistaking water flowing from it as a miracle. The phenomenon, which drew garlands and offerings, was quickly debunked by PCMC officials. An underground water pipeline burst, causing the water to emerge through the tree's trunk, leading to repairs and discussions about awareness.

title: Human-size Labubu doll sold in China: Would you pay 1 million yuan for a toy?
content: A human-sized Labubu figure fetched a record 1.08 million yuan at a Beijing auction, highlighting the doll's soaring popularity. Organized by Yongle International Auction, the event saw enthusiastic bidding both online and in person. The mint-green, 4.3-foot figure, deemed unique, captivated collectors, fueled by endorsements from celebrities like Lisa of Blackpink and David Beckham.

title: ‘Big Beautiful patchup?’ Social media reacts to Musk regretting anti-Trump tweets
content: Elon Musk expressed regret for his critical online posts about Donald Trump. This signals a potential reconciliation after a public feud. The dispute began over spending bills and escalated with accusations and deleted posts. Trump criticized Musk's stance after government subsidies were removed. Musk even suggested Trump was in the Epstein files. Now, Musk's regret hints at a possible resolution.

title: 'If you ever get me married ... ': Sonam’s chilling threat to mother before marriage
content: Vipin, brother of Raja Raghuvanshi, reveals Sonam orchestrated Raja's murder, with her own brother Govind denouncing her actions and demanding severe punishment. Allegations extend to Sonam's mother, accused of prior knowledge. Police investigations uncover pre-marriage planning, including scouting locations and carrying weapons, revealing a calculated plot driven by Sonam's desire to marry Raja.

title: Baba Siddique murder: Key conspirator held in Canada
content: Zeeshan Akhtar, a key suspect in the murder of NCP politician Baba Siddique, has been detained in Canada based on an Interpol notice. Akhtar, linked to the Lawrence and Anmol Bishnoi gang, is accused of planning and funding the murder through multiple bank accounts. He allegedly coordinated with the shooters and provided them with weapons and shelter before fleeing Mumbai.

title: 'Behaviour not conducive for travel': Details of student who was pinned down
content: An Indian student was detained at a US airport and later deported. He had entered the United States illegally. Authorities restrained him and admitted him to a medical facility. The Indian Consulate in New York is engaged with US officials. The US embassy reiterated its stance against illegal immigration.

title: China builds world's largest bullet train network; where does India stand?
content: India's first bullet train project, connecting Mumbai and Ahmedabad, is progressing with 300 km of viaducts completed as of June 2025. Despite delays, the first phase is expected to begin by 2028, cutting travel time significantly. Domestically designed high-speed trains are also in development, promising modern amenities and environmental benefits.

title: TS LAWCET, PGLCET answer key 2025 released: Direct link to download here
content: The Telangana State Council of Higher Education has released the preliminary answer keys for TS LAWCET and PGLCET 2025 exams held on June 6. Candidates can access the answer keys, response sheets, and question papers at lawcet.tsche.ac.in. Objections can be submitted until June 13, with final results expected on June 25, 2025.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Gill has all the ingredients'; ex-India coach lauds selectors
content: Shubman Gill, 25, has been appointed India's Test captain for the upcoming series against England, following Rohit Sharma's retirement. Former cricketers Robin Uthappa and Gary Kirsten have praised the selection, highlighting Gill's leadership qualities and potential for a long tenure. They emphasized his cricketing intelligence, preparation, and ability to inspire, urging patience as he takes on this new role.

title: 'Daisy has driven everyone crazy': Wrong purr-suit? HC clears man of abducting pet cat
content: The Karnataka High Court dismissed a criminal case against Taha Husain, who was accused of stealing a cat named Daisy. Justice Nagaprasanna humorously noted the absurdity of the situation. The court halted proceedings, emphasizing that such frivolous cases burden the criminal justice system.

title: Watch: “Why do I need RCB? I don’t drink Royal Challenge,” says Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar
content: Watch: “Why do I need RCB? I don’t drink Royal Challenge,” says Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar

content: the latest Title Update for EA Sports FC 25 has arrived . players with high Passing attributes have received an accuracy increase on their ground passes . this is supposed to close the gap to athletes with passing-related PlayStyles . the developer wants both types of players to be viable .

title: Future Power Rankings: How all 68 Power 4 college football teams stack up
content: college football 's future power rankings have been reimagined as part of a changing sport . the rankings will examine the next two seasons -- in this case, the 2025 and 2026 seasons -- and function more as a snapshot of the landscape . a spring portal changes things, and QB rooms can look moderately or significantly different by late May or early June .

title: College football's top 25 plays since 2000
content: a college football game guarantees you certain things, you will get tailgate smells . the top 25 plays of the 2000s are voted on by ESPN college football writers . some decided national titles, some provided all-time rivalry bragging rights .

title: Our final college softball rankings: How do the top 25 teams stack up after the WCWS?
content: the 2025 college softball season is over, with the longhorns taking home their first national title . here is the final ESPN.com/USA Softball Collegiate top 25 ranking . the rankings are based on each team's final record .

title: The field of 8 is set: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the field for the men's college world series in Omaha, Nebraska, is set . it'll be the Racers' first time in Omaha . four teams are making their first appearances in Omaha since winning the title the last time they made it this far .

title: Experts' picks and betting tips
content: Scottie Scheffler looks ahead to the 2025 PGA Championship . he tied for 14th at the Masters and eighth at the PGA championship . we break down the favorites and much more ahead of the tournament . it's too easy to pick him, and Rahm is rounding back into major form .

title: NBA Finals betting: Thunder huge title favorites after blowout win
content: Oklahoma City Thunder beat the Indiana Pacers 123-107 in game 2 . the Thunder moved from -325 to -550 to win the title while the Pacers dropped down from +260 to +400 . in the finals MVP race, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (-550) is still the favorite by a wide margin .

title: Ancelotti's first Brazil win seals World Cup spot
content: brazil qualify for the 2026 world cup with a 1-0 win over Paraguay . the win was the first for new manager Carlo Ancelotti . real madrid striker Vincius Jnior scored the game's only goal in the second half .

title: Chisholm hurt, Nola's potential return delayed
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . seven more matinees follow with the remaining seven tilts played under the lights . new york Yankees 3B jazz Chisholm Jr . left last night's game in the seventh inning due to a tight neck .

title: Divisional: New women's bantamweight champion takes the top spot
content: Kayla Harrison becomes the new women's bantamweight champion . she finished Julianna Pea with a beautiful second-round Kimura . pea falls to no. 2 in the men's championship rematch .

title: 💍 Surprise! Aaron Rodgers reveals he's married
content: a ring on his finger drew questions as to what the ring was . "it's a wedding ring," rodgers tells reporters . he's been married for a couple of months but has yet to confirm the identity of his wife .

title: Where Indiana lands among the NBA's most surprising Finals runs
content: the Indiana Pacers host Game 3 of the NBA Finals on friday (8:30 p.m. ET, ABC) it will be the first Finals game in a quarter century . the Pacers needed to knock off a 64-win Cleveland Cavaliers in Round 2, then win a second series .
